first.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: coming before all the other things or people in a series
first.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The first and last mountain I climbed was Mount Rundle  (=it was the only mountain I ever climbed).
The first time I flew on a plane I was really nervous.
In the first year, all students take five courses.
He said the first thing that came into his head.
the first step towards achieving a peace agreement
There’s a meeting on the first Monday of every month.
I only read the first two chapters of the book.
It rained during the first few days of the trip.
first.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Our first priority is to maintain the standard of work.
As I see it, my first responsibility is to my family.
first.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: used in the title of someone’s job or position to show that they have a high rank
first.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: the First Lord of the Admiralty
first.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: An extra five points will be given to the team that finishes first.
First of all we’d better make sure we’ve got everything we need.
first.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: before doing anything else, or before anything else happens
first.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: I’ll join you in a minute but I need to make a phone call first.
first.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: The book was first published in 2000.
first.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: at the beginning of a situation or activity
first.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: When we were first married we lived in Toronto.
We first became friends when we worked together.
first.translation[1].definitions[4].defi: used before saying the first of several things you want to say
first.translation[1].definitions[4].exam: First, I’d like to thank everyone for coming.
first.translation[1].note_box[0].items[0: First is used with the simple past
first.translation[1].note_box[0].items[1: First usually comes before a main verb
I first went to Paris two years ago
first.translation[1].note_box[0].items[2: First comes after ‘be’ when it is the main verb
I was first in Paris two years ago
first.translation[1].note_box[0].items[3: First comes after the first auxiliary
When did you first realize you wanted to be a doctor?
first.translation[1].note_box[1].section: used when mentioning the first in a list of reasons, arguments, or questions to consider
I want you to consider these three points in your essay: first, what is the writer’s attitude to the war in this poem ...
There are several reasons for this conclusion. Firstly ...
used especially to emphasize that the first of several things you are going to say is the most important thing
The content of the article must, first of all, be accurate.
First of all, a huge thank you to everyone who has supported us over the last two years.
used when giving the first and most important reason or example, especially when you are arguing or discussing something with someone
Our main priority should be better public transport – in the first place to reduce the amount of traffic on our roads.
He’s not the right person for the job. For a start he’s too young.
used when telling someone the first and most important thing that you want to say
There are numerous activities on offer. To start with there are over 60 miles of walks with splendid views.
Let me tell you something about him. To begin with, he is the most difficult man that I know.
first.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: something that has never happened or been done before
first.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: These results are firsts in the history of women’s athletics.
‘I think he’ll agree to it.’ ‘That will be a first.’
The 3–0 defeat was a first for the team.
first.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: the highest mark you can get in a university degree in Britain
first.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: Helen got a first in Law.
first.translation[2].definitions[2].defi: the lowest gear in a car or other vehicle, that you use when moving slowly
first.translation[2].definitions[2].exam: He put the car into first and roared away.
You should be in first on a hill like this.
